event.doc_name: Verified Complaint and Ex Parte Application for TRO and PI, Notice of Exparte Application for TRO and PI for Injunctive Relief to Halt Implementation of San Rafael Code 19.50 and SMC 19.20.080(c) on August 16th 2023

Verified Complaint and Ex Parte Application for TRO and PI, Notice of Exparte Application for TRO and PI for Injunctive Relief to Halt Implementation of San Rafael Code 19.50 and SMC 19.20.080(c) on August 16th 2023

Verified Complaint and Ex Parte Application for TRO and PI, Notice of Exparte Application for TRO and PI for Injunctive Relief to Halt Implementation of San Rafael Code 19.50 and SMC 19.20.080(c) on August 16th 2023

evidence.text: Based on infonnation and belief, plaintiffs allege the following: Around June 2023, San Rafael Assistant City Manager Chris Hess, San Rafael City Manager Cristine Alliovich, San Rafael Police Chief D avid Spiller, San Rafael Director of Public Works April Mills communicated through a series meetings and electronic communications to discuss changing the City of San Rafael ordinances regulating the public us of property by people who are do not have housing and live outside.
evidence.source_document: Verified Complaint and Ex Parte Application for TRO and PI, Notice of Exparte Application for TRO and PI for Injunctive Relief to Halt Implementation of San Rafael Code 19.50 and SMC 19.20.080(c) on August 16th 2023

add_extracted.value: Based on infonnation and belief, plaintiffs allege the following: Around June 2023, San Rafael Assistant City Manager Chris Hess, San Rafael City Manager Cristine Alliovich, San Rafael Police Chief D avid Spiller, San Rafael Director of Public Works April Mills communicated through a series meetings and electronic communications to discuss changing the City of San Rafael ordinances regulating the public us of property by people who are do not have housing and live outside.

evidence.text: Hess, Alliovich, Spiller, and Mills decided that the proposed ordinance would single out unhoused people for criminal sanctions for conduct that would not be criminalized for people who did have housing.
evidence.source_document: Verified Complaint and Ex Parte Application for TRO and PI, Notice of Exparte Application for TRO and PI for Injunctive Relief to Halt Implementation of San Rafael Code 19.50 and SMC 19.20.080(c) on August 16th 2023

add_extracted.value: Hess, Alliovich, Spiller, and Mills decided that the proposed ordinance would single out unhoused people for criminal sanctions for conduct that would not be criminalized for people who did have housing.

evidence.text: Their proposed ordinance would also compel unhoused people to camp 200 feet away from one another.
evidence.source_document: Verified Complaint and Ex Parte Application for TRO and PI, Notice of Exparte Application for TRO and PI for Injunctive Relief to Halt Implementation of San Rafael Code 19.50 and SMC 19.20.080(c) on August 16th 2023

add_extracted.value: Their proposed ordinance would also compel unhoused people to camp 200 feet away from one another.

evidence.text: At the end of June, Hess, Alliovich, Spiller, and Mills came to an agreement among themselves about modifying City of San Rafael adding Chapter 19.50 to the city's municipal code.
evidence.source_document: Verified Complaint and Ex Parte Application for TRO and PI, Notice of Exparte Application for TRO and PI for Injunctive Relief to Halt Implementation of San Rafael Code 19.50 and SMC 19.20.080(c) on August 16th 2023

add_extracted.value: At the end of June, Hess, Alliovich, Spiller, and Mills came to an agreement among themselves about modifying City of San Rafael adding Chapter 19.50 to the city's municipal code.

evidence.text: Chris Hess submitted that proposed amendment to Christine Alliovich, who approved it to be submitted to the City of San Rafael city council for ratification.
evidence.source_document: Verified Complaint and Ex Parte Application for TRO and PI, Notice of Exparte Application for TRO and PI for Injunctive Relief to Halt Implementation of San Rafael Code 19.50 and SMC 19.20.080(c) on August 16th 2023

add_extracted.value: Chris Hess submitted that proposed amendment to Christine Alliovich, who approved it to be submitted to the City of San Rafael city council for ratification.

evidence.text: On July 17th 2023 the ordinance was ratified unchanged by the City of San Rafael City Councilmembers, Kate Colin, Eli Hill, Maribeth Bushey, and Rachel Kertz.
evidence.source_document: Verified Complaint and Ex Parte Application for TRO and PI, Notice of Exparte Application for TRO and PI for Injunctive Relief to Halt Implementation of San Rafael Code 19.50 and SMC 19.20.080(c) on August 16th 2023

add_extracted.value: On July 17th 2023 the ordinance was ratified unchanged by the City of San Rafael City Councilmembers, Kate Colin, Eli Hill, Maribeth Bushey, and Rachel Kertz.

evidence.text: Unless enjoined by this court, the ratified ordinance will go in effect on August 16th 2023.
evidence.source_document: Verified Complaint and Ex Parte Application for TRO and PI, Notice of Exparte Application for TRO and PI for Injunctive Relief to Halt Implementation of San Rafael Code 19.50 and SMC 19.20.080(c) on August 16th 2023

add_extracted.value: Unless enjoined by this court, the ratified ordinance will go in effect on August 16th 2023.

evidence.text: Jimmy Sanders intended on participating in this lawsuit, but died in his tent at Camp Integrity on July 29th.
evidence.source_document: Verified Complaint and Ex Parte Application for TRO and PI, Notice of Exparte Application for TRO and PI for Injunctive Relief to Halt Implementation of San Rafael Code 19.50 and SMC 19.20.080(c) on August 16th 2023

add_extracted.value: Jimmy Sanders intended on participating in this lawsuit, but died in his tent at Camp Integrity on July 29th.
